choices.text:
what is a Hendiadys?
A hendiadys (also known as a "polyptoton") is a figure of speech in which two or more words are used to express a single idea, where the conjunction "and" is often omitted. It involves joining together multiple nouns, verbs, adjectives, or other parts of speech into one phrase that functions as a single unit. For example:
- She wore her hat and coat (instead of saying she wore her hat and put on her coat)
- He'll be working late tonight and tomorrow morning (instead of saying he'll be working late tonight, then again in the morning).
